post.body: nice news on black mountain bitter, and it's certified organic by my Alma Mater. Btw, Pisgah Brewing's founder is an alum also.
@mondaynightbrew guess my company doesn't follow either philosophy, since they just laid off two from my office.
just sent you a station via email (outlier) that you may dig. Based on Indy Musicians from Jacksonville Beach FL.
how do places like bottle trek get away with it? Even though I haven't placed an order to confirm that it is "legal" to GA.
I was personally very happy to see Jed announce to the everyone how much he loves them... he's so sensitive!
is that coming to me ? :)
all grain or extract?
can you share who the manufacturer is?
that's pretty neat. Where did it come from? A local winery? Distiller?
good choice by the managing editor!
t-minus 8 hours till 2 weeks of vacation...
hard day... backwoods bastard is a well deserved reward
crap... Prince of Persia is on sale for $40 at amazon for the 360...
$21 for a 2 year old 22 oz Barleywine at 5 Seasons with dinner. It was good, but I don't know if it was $21 good.
Excited about dinner at http://www.5seasonsbrewing.com tonight with work... and the wife is driving so i can enjoy a good Barleywine!
fun linux typo, running "ddate" gives this: "Today is Setting Orange, the 58th day of The Aftermath in the YOLD 3174"
Any of you Colorado guys know if Great Divide distributes to the Boston Area?
RT @dogfishbeer: Dogfish will be on Discovery Channel Thursday 8pm... "How Stuff Works" & the topic for the 12/18 episode is BEER!
Anyone want to share their pandora stations? I'm looking for something "different"...
Dark Knight shipping today from Netflix... Sweet.
Anyone have a favorite beer of the month club they subscribe too?
put my son down for bed and he pretty much declared a "do over"... fortunately bedtime mulligans are permitted
http://twitpic.com/sa4g - My Son Force Carbonating
RT @CharliePapazian: Beer Examiner: Beer. How Stuff Works will be repeated on Discovery Channel, January 2. http://tinyurl.com/charliebeer
Watching Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind. Bizarre.
The English Mild has begun the boil. 2 points high on preboil gravity.
20 more mins on the mash. Strike evened out about 10 deg lower than calculated, but after adjusting, mashing about 2 deg lower than target.
http://twitpic.com/wu99 - Mmmm Chocolate Indulgence
Looks like we'll be brewing an English Mild this Saturday if anyone in the local twitter-verse is interested... direct msg me for details.
thinking about a Saison Dupont to go with dinner. Does a Saison go with horseradish encrusted beef tenderloin?
Wow... Mushroom Risotto, Pork Tenderloin, Sauteed Brussel Sprouts and a SA Imperial Pils.
My official stance on Left Hand Snowbound is too much spice. Not un-drinkable, but a little much.
Wow... That is a SPICED winter ale.
Left Hand Snowbound Winter Ale is my reward for it being Tuesday
Squirrel in the attic, time to go buy a trap
Kegged the American Rye Ale today. Thought it had a odd aroma and taste, but then I had a Terrapin Rye Ale with dinner, almost identical.
Just finished watching the Dark Knight with the wife. Good stuff.
If I can't do beer with dinner, port with desert works for me... And we had a tawny and a ruby to try tonight. I prefer the tawny.
About to sit down to watch The Dark Knight
I think I am influencing my mother in laws beer selection... 4 different craft porters in her fridge (score!)
